meanings.definition: The practice of political bossism or corruption.
meanings.sent1: Caciquism can lead to unfair advantages in politics.
meanings.sent2: The town was under the grip of caciquism, with the local boss controlling everything.
meanings.sent3: The caciquism in the city council made even the pigeons suspicious.
meanings.sent4: The caciquism of the mayor cast a shadow over the entire town.
meanings.sent5: The caciquism was like a dark cloud hanging over the political landscape.

meanings.definition: The system of rule by local political bosses.
meanings.sent1: In some regions, caciquism dictates every decision made.
meanings.sent2: Caciquism often results in favoritism and corruption.
meanings.sent3: The caciquism in the small town was like a poorly written play.
meanings.sent4: Under the caciquism, the town felt like a kingdom ruled by a single tyrant.
meanings.sent5: The caciquism was so entrenched that it seemed impossible to break free from its grasp.

meanings.definition: The influence or power of a political boss.
meanings.sent1: The caciquism of the senator was felt throughout the state.
meanings.sent2: Caciquism can make or break a candidate's chances in an election.
meanings.sent3: The caciquism at the party convention turned the event into a circus.
meanings.sent4: Her caciquism over the local government was unmatched.
meanings.sent5: The caciquism was like a web, ensnaring all who dared to challenge it.
